snippet: Addressing a longtime complaint of Tamil leaders, President Maithripala Sirisena replaced a retired army commander with a retired diplomat.
abstract: Sri Lankan Pres Maithripala Sirisena seeks to assuage ethnic Tamils in Northern Province with announcement that longtime diplomat H M G S Palihakkara will replace province's governor Maj Gen G A Chandrasiri, retired general who commanded army forces during country's brutal civil war.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Addressing a longtime complaint of Tamil leaders, President Maithripala Sirisena replaced a retired army commander with a retired diplomat.

headline.main: In Gesture to Tamils, Sri Lanka Replaces Provincial Leader
headline.print_headline: In Gesture to Tamils, Sri Lanka Replaces Provincial Leader
